documentation.text:
@title BlockhashStore
@notice This contract provides a way to access blockhashes older than
  the 256 block limit imposed by the BLOCKHASH opcode.
  You may assume that any blockhash stored by the contract is correct.
  Note that the contract depends on the format of serialized Ethereum
  blocks. If a future hardfork of Ethereum changes that format, the 
  logic in this contract may become incorrect and an updated version 
  would have to be deployed.

@notice stores blockhash of a given block, assuming it is available through BLOCKHASH
@param n the number of the block whose blockhash should be stored
@notice stores blockhash of the earliest block still available through BLOCKHASH.

@notice gets a blockhash from the store. If no hash is known, this function reverts.
@param n the number of the block whose blockhash should be returned

attributes.text:
@title BlockhashStore
@notice This contract provides a way to access blockhashes older than
  the 256 block limit imposed by the BLOCKHASH opcode.
  You may assume that any blockhash stored by the contract is correct.
  Note that the contract depends on the format of serialized Ethereum
  blocks. If a future hardfork of Ethereum changes that format, the 
  logic in this contract may become incorrect and an updated version 
  would have to be deployed.

@notice stores blockhash of a given block, assuming it is available through BLOCKHASH
@param n the number of the block whose blockhash should be stored
@notice stores blockhash of the earliest block still available through BLOCKHASH.

@notice gets a blockhash from the store. If no hash is known, this function reverts.
@param n the number of the block whose blockhash should be returned

params.n: the number of the block whose blockhash should be returned
the number of the block whose blockhash should be stored

params.header: the rlp-encoded blockheader of block n+1. We verify its correctness by checking  that it hashes to a stored blockhash, and then extract parentHash to get the n-th blockhash.
params.n: the number of the block whose blockhash should be stored

getBlockhash(uint256).notice: gets a blockhash from the store. If no hash is known, this function reverts.

store(uint256).notice: stores blockhash of a given block, assuming it is available through BLOCKHASH

storeEarliest().notice: stores blockhash of the earliest block still available through BLOCKHASH.

storeVerifyHeader(uint256,bytes).notice: stores blockhash after verifying blockheader of child/subsequent block

userdoc.notice: This contract provides a way to access blockhashes older than  the 256 block limit imposed by the BLOCKHASH opcode.  You may assume that any blockhash stored by the contract is correct.  Note that the contract depends on the format of serialized Ethereum  blocks. If a future hardfork of Ethereum changes that format, the   logic in this contract may become incorrect and an updated version   would have to be deployed.
